conclusion: Analyze forces acting on sphere D to find pressure on spheres A, B, and C.
Four spheres are stacked in a cone shape with D on top of A, B, and C.
Sphere D is subject to gravitational force mg acting downward.
Normal forces from spheres A, B, and C must balance gravitational force on D.
Normal force exerted by each lower sphere on D is equal due to symmetry.
Normal forces act along the line connecting centers of D and each lower sphere.
Each normal force N can be decomposed into vertical and horizontal components.
Vertical component of force must support the weight of D.
Vertical component of force is N cos θ, where θ is angle between normal force and vertical.
Total vertical component from all three spheres must balance weight of D: 3N cos θ = mg.
Geometry of tetrahedral arrangement provides angle θ.
In tetrahedron with edge length √3r, angle θ is given by cos θ = 1/3.
Substitute cos θ = 1/3 into force equation: 3N (1/3) = mg, solving gives N = mg.
Pressure exerted by D on each lower sphere is equal to normal force N.
Pressure exerted by D on each of A, B, and C is mg.
